channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Detecting Vulnerable Nodes in Urban Infrastructure Interdependent Network
item.description: Understanding and characterizing the vulnerability of urban infrastructures, which refers to the engineering facilities essential for the regular running of cities and that exist naturally in the form of networks, is of great value to us.

item.title: Watch out Venomous Snake Species: A Solution to SnakeCLEF2023
item.description: The SnakeCLEF2023 competition aims to the development of advanced algorithms for snake species identification through the analysis of images and accompanying metadata.

item.title: DialogStudio: Towards Richest and Most Diverse Unified Dataset Collection for Conversational AI
item.description: Despite advancements in conversational AI, language models encounter challenges to handle diverse conversational tasks, and existing dialogue dataset collections often lack diversity and comprehensiveness.

item.title: Improved Distribution Matching for Dataset Condensation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel dataset condensation method based on distribution matching, which is more efficient and promising.

item.title: DISA: DIfferentiable Similarity Approximation for Universal Multimodal Registration
item.description: Our method is several orders of magnitude faster than local patch-based metrics and can be directly applied in clinical settings by replacing the similarity measure with the proposed one.

item.title: BSDM: Background Suppression Diffusion Model for Hyperspectral Anomaly Detection
item.description: We present a novel solution BSDM (background suppression diffusion model) for HAD, which can simultaneously learn latent background distributions and generalize to different datasets for suppressing complex background.

item.title: Longitudinal Data and a Semantic Similarity Reward for Chest X-Ray Report Generation
item.description: The results indicate that longitudinal data improves CXR report generation.

item.title: FABRIC: Personalizing Diffusion Models with Iterative Feedback
item.description: In an era where visual content generation is increasingly driven by machine learning, the integration of human feedback into generative models presents significant opportunities for enhancing user experience and output quality.

item.title: Multi-Grained Multimodal Interaction Network for Entity Linking
item.description: Then, to derive the similarity matching score for each mention-entity pair, we device three interaction units to comprehensively explore the intra-modal interaction and inter-modal fusion among features of entities and mentions.

item.title: RaTE: a Reproducible automatic Taxonomy Evaluation by Filling the Gap
item.description: Taxonomies are an essential knowledge representation, yet most studies on automatic taxonomy construction (ATC) resort to manual evaluation to score proposed algorithms.

item.title: PyTAG: Challenges and Opportunities for Reinforcement Learning in Tabletop Games
item.description: To bridge this gap, we introduce PyTAG, a Python API for interacting with the Tabletop Games framework (TAG).

item.title: Towards Reliable Rare Category Analysis on Graphs via Individual Calibration
item.description: In particular, to quantify the uncertainties in RCA, we develop a node-level uncertainty quantification algorithm to model the overlapping support regions with high uncertainty; to handle the rarity of minority classes in miscalibration calculation, we generalize the distribution-based calibration metric to the instance level and propose the first individual calibration measurement on graphs named Expected Individual Calibration Error (EICE).

item.title: Benchmarking Potential Based Rewards for Learning Humanoid Locomotion
item.description: Although several studies have explored the use of potential based reward shaping to accelerate learning convergence, most have been limited to grid-worlds and low-dimensional systems, and RL in robotics has predominantly relied on standard forms of reward shaping.

item.title: Entropy regularization in probabilistic clustering
item.description: The proposed estimator is equivalent to a post-processing procedure that reduces the number of sparsely-populated clusters and enhances interpretability.

item.title: Semantic-Aware Dual Contrastive Learning for Multi-label Image Classification
item.description: Specifically, we leverage semantic-aware representation learning to extract category-related local discriminative features and construct category prototypes.

item.title: Android in the Wild: A Large-Scale Dataset for Android Device Control
item.description: The dataset contains human demonstrations of device interactions, including the screens and actions, and corresponding natural language instructions.

item.title: Forecasting Early with Meta Learning
item.description: In the early observation period of a time series, there might be only a few historic observations available to learn a model.

item.title: Deep unrolling Shrinkage Network for Dynamic MR imaging
item.description: In particular, we put forward a novel deep unrolling shrinkage network (DUS-Net) by unrolling the alternating direction method of multipliers (ADMM) for optimizing the transformed $l_1$ norm dynamic MR reconstruction model.

item.title: Towards Saner Deep Image Registration
item.description: Moreover, we derive a set of theoretical guarantees for our sanity-checked image registration method, with experimental results supporting our theoretical findings and their effectiveness in increasing the sanity of models without sacrificing any performance.

item.title: Source-Free Domain Adaptation for Medical Image Segmentation via Prototype-Anchored Feature Alignment and Contrastive Learning
item.description: To tackle the source data-absent problem, we present a novel two-stage source-free domain adaptation (SFDA) framework for medical image segmentation, where only a well-trained source segmentation model and unlabeled target data are available during domain adaptation.

item.title: CValues: Measuring the Values of Chinese Large Language Models from Safety to Responsibility
item.description: In this paper, we present CValues, the first Chinese human values evaluation benchmark to measure the alignment ability of LLMs in terms of both safety and responsibility criteria.

item.title: GenKL: An Iterative Framework for Resolving Label Ambiguity and Label Non-conformity in Web Images Via a New Generalized KL Divergence
item.description: To tackle the limitation of entropy maximization, we propose $(\alpha, \beta)$-generalized KL divergence, $\mathcal{D}_{\text{KL}}^{\alpha, \beta}(p\|q)$, which can be used to identify significantly more NC instances.

item.title: From West to East: Who can understand the music of the others better?
item.description: This leads to research questions on whether these models can be used to learn representations for different music cultures and styles, or whether we can build similar music audio embedding models trained on data from different cultures or styles.

item.title: MVA2023 Small Object Detection Challenge for Spotting Birds: Dataset, Methods, and Results
item.description: Small Object Detection (SOD) is an important machine vision topic because (i) a variety of real-world applications require object detection for distant objects and (ii) SOD is a challenging task due to the noisy, blurred, and less-informative image appearances of small objects.

item.title: Multimodal Machine Learning for Extraction of Theorems and Proofs in the Scientific Literature
item.description: Finally, a simple CRF-based approach uses the features of the multimodal model along with information on block sequences.

item.title: Alioth: A Machine Learning Based Interference-Aware Performance Monitor for Multi-Tenancy Applications in Public Cloud
item.description: Multi-tenancy in public clouds may lead to co-location interference on shared resources, which possibly results in performance degradation of cloud applications.

item.title: Enhancing Network Slicing Architectures with Machine Learning, Security, Sustainability and Experimental Networks Integration
item.description: Network Slicing (NS) is an essential technique extensively used in 5G networks computing strategies, mobile edge computing, mobile cloud computing, and verticals like the Internet of Vehicles and industrial IoT, among others.

item.title: Llama 2: Open Foundation and Fine-Tuned Chat Models
item.description: In this work, we develop and release Llama 2, a collection of pretrained and fine-tuned large language models (LLMs) ranging in scale from 7 billion to 70 billion parameters.

item.title: OnlineRefer: A Simple Online Baseline for Referring Video Object Segmentation
item.description: Referring video object segmentation (RVOS) aims at segmenting an object in a video following human instruction.

item.title: Object-aware Gaze Target Detection
item.description: Gaze target detection aims to predict the image location where the person is looking and the probability that a gaze is out of the scene.

item.title: What Can Simple Arithmetic Operations Do for Temporal Modeling?
item.description: We conduct comprehensive ablation studies on the instantiation of ATMs and demonstrate that this module provides powerful temporal modeling capability at a low computational cost.

item.title: FedDefender: Client-Side Attack-Tolerant Federated Learning
item.description: Evaluations of real-world scenarios across multiple datasets show that the proposed method enhances the robustness of federated learning against model poisoning attacks.

item.title: EigenTrajectory: Low-Rank Descriptors for Multi-Modal Trajectory Forecasting
item.description: In this paper, we present EigenTrajectory ($\mathbb{ET}$), a trajectory prediction approach that uses a novel trajectory descriptor to form a compact space, known here as $\mathbb{ET}$ space, in place of Euclidean space, for representing pedestrian movements.

item.title: Constraining Depth Map Geometry for Multi-View Stereo: A Dual-Depth Approach with Saddle-shaped Depth Cells
item.description: Learning-based multi-view stereo (MVS) methods deal with predicting accurate depth maps to achieve an accurate and complete 3D representation.

item.title: Evaluate Fine-tuning Strategies for Fetal Head Ultrasound Image Segmentation with U-Net
item.description: This method addresses the challenges associated with training a CNN network from scratch.

item.title: Pixel-wise Graph Attention Networks for Person Re-identification
item.description: Based on these two modules, we consulted the ResNet and design a pixel-wise graph attention network (PGANet).

item.title: Towards a performance analysis on pre-trained Visual Question Answering models for autonomous driving
item.description: This short paper presents a preliminary analysis of three popular Visual Question Answering (VQA) models, namely ViLBERT, ViLT, and LXMERT, in the context of answering questions relating to driving scenarios.

item.title: Efficient Region-Aware Neural Radiance Fields for High-Fidelity Talking Portrait Synthesis
item.description: This paper presents ER-NeRF, a novel conditional Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) based architecture for talking portrait synthesis that can concurrently achieve fast convergence, real-time rendering, and state-of-the-art performance with small model size.

item.title: Overthinking the Truth: Understanding how Language Models Process False Demonstrations
item.description: The first phenomenon, overthinking, appears when we decode predictions from intermediate layers, given correct vs. incorrect few-shot demonstrations.

item.title: Learning to Select SAT Encodings for Pseudo-Boolean and Linear Integer Constraints
item.description: We show that it is possible to select encodings effectively using a standard set of features for constraint problems; however we obtain better performance with a new set of features specifically designed for the pseudo-Boolean and linear constraints.

item.title: Online Self-Supervised Thermal Water Segmentation for Aerial Vehicles
item.description: We present a new method to adapt an RGB-trained water segmentation network to target-domain aerial thermal imagery using online self-supervision by leveraging texture and motion cues as supervisory signals.

item.title: PatchCT: Aligning Patch Set and Label Set with Conditional Transport for Multi-Label Image Classification
item.description: We find that by formulating the multi-label classification as a CT problem, we can exploit the interactions between the image and label efficiently by minimizing the bidirectional CT cost.

item.title: Frequency-mixed Single-source Domain Generalization for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: Consequently, domain generalization (DG) is developed to boost the performance of segmentation models on unseen domains.

item.title: Accuracy versus time frontiers of semi-supervised and self-supervised learning on medical images
item.description: This study contributes a carefully-designed benchmark to help answer a practitioner's key question: given a small labeled dataset and a limited budget of hours to spend on training, what gains from additional unlabeled images are possible and which methods best achieve them?

item.title: RepViT: Revisiting Mobile CNN From ViT Perspective
item.description: On ImageNet, RepViT achieves over 80\% top-1 accuracy with nearly 1ms latency on an iPhone 12, which is the first time for a lightweight model, to the best of our knowledge.

item.title: NTK-approximating MLP Fusion for Efficient Language Model Fine-tuning
item.description: Fine-tuning a pre-trained language model (PLM) emerges as the predominant strategy in many natural language processing applications.

item.title: OxfordVGG Submission to the EGO4D AV Transcription Challenge
item.description: This report presents the technical details of our submission on the EGO4D Audio-Visual (AV) Automatic Speech Recognition Challenge 2023 from the OxfordVGG team.

item.title: End-to-End Neural Network Training for Hyperbox-Based Classification
item.description: Hyperbox-based classification has been seen as a promising technique in which decisions on the data are represented as a series of orthogonal, multidimensional boxes (i. e., hyperboxes) that are often interpretable and human-readable.

item.title: Application of BERT in Wind Power Forecasting-Teletraan's Solution in Baidu KDD Cup 2022
item.description: Nowadays, wind energy has drawn increasing attention as its important role in carbon neutrality and sustainable development.

item.title: Using the IBM Analog In-Memory Hardware Acceleration Kit for Neural Network Training and Inference
item.description: Analog In-Memory Computing (AIMC) is a promising approach to reduce the latency and energy consumption of Deep Neural Network (DNN) inference and training.
